?Vars #:: ?Range

Range constraint combined with integrality constraint
Vars
Variable or integer, or a list of variables or integers
Range
Variable or Lo..Hi, where Lo and Hi are variables or integer expressions

Description

This constraint suspends until its arguments are ground. It then succeeds iff all the elements of the list Vars are integers within the range specified by Range.

The range must eventually be in the form Lo..Hi, where Lo and Hi are expressions evaluating to integers.

Fail Conditions

Vars contains non-integers or integers that do not fall within Range.

Exceptions

(5) type error
Range contains non-integers.

Examples

    ?- X #:: 1 .. 5, X = 3.
    X = 3
    Yes (0.00s cpu)

    ?- X #:: 1 .. 5, X = 6.
    No (0.00s cpu)

    ?- X #:: 1 .. 5, X = 3.0.
    No (0.00s cpu)

See Also

$:: / 2, :: / 2, #:: / 3, integers / 1, reals / 1
